title.narrative: Huai River Basin Flood Management and Drainage Improvement

description.narrative: The objective of the Huai River Basin Flood Management and Drainage Improvement Project for China is to provide better and more secure protection against floods and water logging, increase farmland productivity, and reduce property losses in predominantly poor rural areas in the Huai river basin in the provinces of Jiangsu, Shandong, Anhui and Henan. There are five components to the project, the first component being flood protection and drainage improvement. Carrying out of flood protection and drainage improvement works in the project area including: strengthening of dikes; improving waterways through, inter alia, river dredging, drainage channel excavation, and river bank reinforcement and stabilization; and construction, rehabilitation, replacement and expansion of flood control works, including pumping stations, cross-dike structures, sluice gates and bridges. The second component is the disaster assessment and support system. The third component is the institutional strengthening. Strengthening the capacity of the project implementing entities in critical areas related to the project including: dike maintenance; design and construction; modern construction technologies; and data collection and decision support systems for flood forecasting systems, emergency preparedness plans and river modeling. The fourth component is the resettlement action plan implementation. Finally, the fifth component is the project management.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :PA/Schedule/Section I/2. | Description :Each project province and HRBC shall install and operationalize for usethe Procurement and Financial Management Information Systemno later than ninety days after the Effective Date, and the | Due Date:26-Apr-2011

Finance Agreement :PA/Schedule/Section I/2. | Description :Each project province and HRBC, as relevant, shall carry out externalmonitoring of RAPs and Policy Framework for Resettlement and Land Acquisition. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :PA/Schedule/Section I/2. | Description :Each project province and HRBC, as relevant, shall implement the Projectin accordance with Project Implementation Plan (PIP), EMPs, RAPs, Policy Framework for Resettlement and Land Acquisiti | Frequency:Yearly

Finance Agreement :PA/Schedule/Section I/2. | Description :Each project province shall prepare an operation and maintenance planfor irrigation and drainage systems constructed or rehabilitated in the Project Province, at least three months prior to |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :PA/Schedule/Section I/2. | Description :Each project province shall: (i) carry out a pilot program in 2011comprising rehabilitation of on-farm drainage and irrigation works, and establishment of an FDIA with the objective of secur |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :PA/Schedule/Section I/2. | Description :HRBC shall establish by September 30, 2016 a flood disaster assessmentand support system at the basin level of Huai River in the Project Area to provide a timely decision making support duri | Due Date:30-Sep-2016

title.narrative: PO1: Targeted rural and urban areas protected from flooding
IO6: Targeted number of major actions taken as per the EMPs implemented with budget allocated.
IO8: Percent of targeted investment completed on hydraulic model
IO4: Targeted number of O&M plans approved and implemented
IO13: Targeted number of contracts which strictly follow the Bank procurement and financial management guidelines
IO5: Number of functioning FDIAs established as per requirements
IO10: Targeted number of government officials who understand and help disseminate the project innovations
IO12:Targeted number of resettled people whose incomes and lives maintained or improved
PO2: Targeted number of people protected from flooding
IO11: Targeted number of project-affected people whose incomes and lives maintained or improved
IO3: Targeted number of structures constructed including pumping stations, dike structures and flood control gates and bridges
IO7: Percent of targeted investment completed on flood disaster assessment and decision support system
IO1: Targeted length of dike strengthening
PO3: Targeted economic losses in urban and rural areas reduced from flooding
IO2: Targeted length of river improvements
PO5: Targeted increase of navigation benefits from river improvements
PO4: Targeted increase of per capita agricultural incomes of farmers from flood protection
IO9: Accuracy of targeted technical criteria reached by the flood disaster assessment and decision support system

target.value: 1. data collection rate 90%;2. Error between computed and actual inundated area 15%; and 3. Percent of the errors betweenforecasted and actual flood peak level less than 0.2- 0.3 m: 90%
